definitions.definition: to display an item on one's body for others to see the potential effect on their own bodies, especially in regard to wearing clothing while performing the role of a fashion model
examples: She modelled the shoes for her friends to appreciate.

definitions.definition: To devise a model of (some original), especially to better understand or forecast the original.
examples: They modelled weather patterns using a computer.

definitions.definition: To make a miniature model of.
examples: He takes great pride in his skill at modeling airplanes.

definitions.definition: To create from a substance such as clay .
examples: The sculptor modelled the clay into the form of a dolphin.

definitions.definition: To make a model or models.
To work as a model in art or fashion.
examples: The actress used to model before being discovered by Hollywood.

main_definition: ( transitive ) to display an item on one's body for others to see the potential effect on their own bodies, especially in regard to wearing clothing while performing the role of a fashion model
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To devise a model of (some original), especially to better understand or forecast the original.
( transitive ) To make a miniature model of.
( transitive ) To create from a substance such as clay .
( intransitive ) To make a model or models.
( intransitive ) To work as a model in art or fashion.
